[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt inclusion of unrelated paragraphs (e.g., "worthy tipstaff," millennium discussion) disrupts syntactic flow.
[LEXICON]: Archaic phrasing (e.g., "seas of blood and tears," "tipstaff") may impede modern readability.

[STRUCTURE]: Illogical insertion of non-war-themed paragraphs (e.g., legal/godmother scene, millennium philosophy) shatters thematic continuity.
[LOGIC]: Overly broad, unsupported claims (e.g., "Russiaâ€™s sacrifices... made possible the delivery of the final blow").

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex, lengthy sentences (e.g., "It is just as easy--from an examination...")
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift in topic (artists discussion unrelated to preceding war analysis)

[STRUCTURE]: Unrelated paragraph about artists disrupts thematic consistency
[CLARITY]: Assumes external historical context (e.g., "the French Revolution," "Gibbon") without explanation
